title: SoftBank urges WeWork to put off its IPO as valuation sinks: report
text: WeWork's largest investor -- Japan's SoftBank Group Corp. 9984, -0.84% -- is urging the property-management company to shelve its initial public offering, the Financial Times reported late Monday. That comes a day after the Wall Street Journal said WeWork's parent, We Co., may reduce the valuation of the company at IPO time to less than $20 billion -- well below the $47 billion it was valued at last year after a funding round -- following a skeptical reception by potential investors amid concerns about its cash burn and corporate governance. The Journal also reported some current investors were urging the IPO to be shelved. SoftBank and its Vision Fund have invested about $10 billion into WeWork. The FT reported SoftBank's enthusiasm for the IPO has dissipated as WeWork's valuation has been slashed.
